REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(email, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_email function returns a contact object from the database based on the email address provided.
Args:

email (str): The email address of the contact to be retrieved. db (Session, optional): SQLAlchemy Session instance. Defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • email – Filter the query

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first contact found by the email address

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact from the database by its id.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be returned

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_name(contact_name, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_name function returns a list of contacts that match the contact_name parameter.

Parameters:

  • contact_name – Filter the database query

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

All contacts with the name specified in the contact_name parameter

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_surname(contact_surname, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_surname function returns a list of contacts with the given surname.

Parameters:

  • contact_surname – Filter the query

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts with the given surname

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_by_birthdays(db: Session)¶

The get_contacts_by_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id, db: Session)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Find the contact in the database

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id, db: Session)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactModel): The updated contact information. db (Session): A connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – Get the contact from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.contacts.validate_birthday(brth: date)¶
The validate_birthday function takes a date object as an argument and returns the number of days until that birthday.

If the birthday has already passed this year, it will return the number of days until next year’s birthday.

Parameters:

brth – date: Pass the user’s birthday into the function

Returns:

The number of days until the user’s birthday

Doc-author:

Andriy

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user who is trying to confirm their account

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object or none if no user is found

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Andriy

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the contact information from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • _ – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contactmodel object

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_email(contact_email: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_email function is used to get a contact by email.

The function takes in the contact_email and db as parameters, and returns the contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_email – str: Get the email of the contact

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • _ – User: Check if the user is authenticated

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact by its id.

The function takes an integer as the contact_id parameter, which is required and must be greater than 1. It also takes a database session object (db) and the current user (_). If no such contact exists, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404 Not Found.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • _ – User: Get the current user, and the db: session parameter is used to get a database session

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_name(contact_name: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact_by_name function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given name. If no such contact exists, it will return a 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_name – str: Get the contact name from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • _ – User: Pass the current user to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_surname(contact_surname: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_surname function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given surname.

If no such contact exists, it will return an HTTP 404 error.

Parameters:

  • contact_surname – str: Pass the surname of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • _ – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact with a given surname

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database connection to the function

  • _ – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_by_birthdays function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the current month.

The function is called by the get_contacts_by_birthdays endpoint, which requires authentication.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • _ – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts that have a birthday in the next 30 days

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that will be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • _ – User: Ensure that the user is logged in

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id of the contact to be updated, and a body containing all fields that need updating. If no such contact exists, it returns 404 Not Found.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact model to the function

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • _ – User: Ensure that the user is logged in

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Andriy

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It requires authentication, and it uses the auth_service to get the current user.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Receive the file from the client

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The user object after updating the avatar

Doc-author:

Andriy

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular User object

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access token and refresh token

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If there is no valid user associated with the given email address or if there are any errors during decoding or creating tokens then an HTTPException will be raised.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed user with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Andriy

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored in the database. A background task sends an email to the user with their username.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user’s email and password from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A new user

Doc-author:

Andriy

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds,

the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 60 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current object

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Andriy

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s email address

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email address and a timestamp

Doc-author:

Andriy

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token encoded with the user’s id, username, and email

Doc-author:

Andriy

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function takes in a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if successful. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail message ERROR_SCOPE_TOKEN.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who has a valid refresh token

Doc-author:

Andriy

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object from the database, as well as the token

Doc-author:

Andriy

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token that was sent to the user’s email address

Returns:

The email of the user who is currently logged in

Doc-author:

Andriy

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Andriy

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that the user entered

  • hashed_password – Check the password against the hashed version of it

Returns:

A boolean value true or false

Doc-author:

Andriy

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is used as part of a URL that will be included in an HTML template for sending emails.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Pass the email address of the user

  • username – str: Identify the user who is registering

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Andriy

REST API service Roles¶

class src.services.roles.RolesAccess(allowed_roles: List[Role])¶

Bases: object

REST API service Avatar¶

class src.services.upload_avatar.UploadService¶

Bases: object

static create_name_avatar(email: str, prefix: str)¶

The create_name_avatar function takes an email and a prefix, hashes the email, and returns a string of the form ‘prefix/name’ where name is the first 10 characters of the hashed email. This function is used to create unique names for avatars.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • prefix – str: Specify the directory in which the avatar will be stored

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Andriy

static get_url_avatar(public_id, version)¶
The get_url_avatar function takes in a public_id and version number,

then returns the url of the avatar image.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Specify the image to be retrieved from cloudinary

  • version – Get the image from a specific version

Returns:

The url of the avatar image

Doc-author:

Andriy

static upload(file, public_id)¶

The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments. It then uploads the file to Cloudinary using the public_id provided. The function returns a dictionary containing information about the uploaded image.

Parameters:

  • file – Get the file that is being uploaded

  • public_id – Specify the name of the file in cloudinary

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys:

Doc-author:

Andriy
